channel.title: [VB] Executable Code Library
channel.description:
Well, I sometimes tend to forget the syntax for some codes, so I made a simple application to save and show code snippets.
Basically you select one of the examples on right, and what ever you have wrote about the subject will show in the big textbox. You can quickly make them by just typing whatever you want in the main textbox, naming it in the namebox and clicking "New". That's it. The list is sorted alphabetically so you might want to separate your codes for different programming languages like this [C++]API-Something, [VB]API-Something, etc. I added a few VB.net codes, for example.
You shouldn't need any instructions using it, it's rather simple. Once you have a nice and large library there, you might want to do some charity, and compress & upload & link it here, so others can enjoy it as well.
Here's the download link: [url=http://www.speedyshare.com/585118427.html]http://www.speedyshare.com/928559498.html[/url] And here's a picture. [img]http://i34.tinypic.com/2igds0z.jpg[/img] <3 Dark~

item.title: [VB] Executable Code Library
item.dc:creator: @Tree Tree
item.description:
@Tree wrote:

[quote=“Dark Anima, post:6, topic:242992”]Sure.
I just had a fantastic idea, a program that works just as this one, except it would act as a client, and load / add the codes from / to a database. Everyone would get everyone’s codes, and in no time the library would actually be useful. Of cource there should be some kind of password to add entrys in the database, due to EvUl HaXXoRz who will pump it full of lines like “eat me”, and the password would be given to trusted people. What do ya think fellows, could this work?[/quote]

Perhaps make people apply for a developer key before they can add/remove/modify their or others code.

Read full topic
